How many base 10 four-digit numbers, $N = \underline{a} \underline{b} \underline{c} \underline{d}$, satisfy all three of the following conditions?\\
\\
(i) $4,000 \leq N < 6,000;$\\
(ii) $N$ is a multiple of 5;\\
(iii) $3 \leq b < c \leq 6$.\\
\\
$
\mathbf{(A)}\;  10\qquad
\mathbf{(B)}\;  18\qquad
\mathbf{(C)}\;  24\qquad
\mathbf{(D)}\;  36\qquad
\mathbf{(E)}\;  48$
